content.description: A car retailer wanted to see if there is a linear relationship between overall mileage and the suggested retail price of a car. The retailer collected data on 18 cars of a similar type selected at random and used the data to test the claim that there is a linear relationship. The following hypotheses were used to test the claim.
content.question: <math alttext="H sub 0: beta sub 1 equals 0. H sub a: beta sub 1 is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math> The test yielded a <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 2.186 with a corresponding <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.044. Which of the following is the correct interpretation of the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value?

choices.label: If there is a linear relationship between overall mileage and the suggested retail price of a car, the probability of observing a test statistic at least as extreme as 2.186 is 0.044.
If there is not a linear relationship between overall mileage and the suggested retail price of a car, the probability of observing a test statistic at least as extreme as 2.186 is 0.044.
If there is not a linear relationship between overall mileage and the suggested retail price of a car, the probability of observing a test statistic of 2.186 or greater is 0.044.
If there is not a linear relationship between overall mileage and the suggested retail price of a car, the probability of observing a test statistic of 2.186 is 0.044.
If there is a linear relationship between overall mileage and the suggested retail price of a car, the probability of observing a test statistic of 2.186 or greater is 0.044.

content.answer: If there is not a linear relationship between overall mileage and the suggested retail price of a car, the probability of observing a test statistic at least as extreme as 2.186 is 0.044.

topic.text: 9.5: Carrying Out a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
